requestId.description: A unique id for this request. Please always provide this to support.

cursor.description: Opaque token for retrieving the next set of results

hasMore.description: Indicates if more results exist beyond this page

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Property foo is required but is missing.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. This value should not change between occurrences of the error.

type.description: A URI reference to human-readable documentation for the error.

location.description: Where the error occurred, e.g. 'body.items[3].tags' or 'path.thing-id'

fix.description: A human-readable message describing how to fix the error.

errors.description: Optional list of individual error details

V2RatelimitSetOverrideRequestBody.description: Sets a new or overwrites an existing override.

namespaceId.description: The id of the namespace. Either namespaceId or namespaceName must be provided

namespaceName.description: The name of the namespace. Either namespaceId or namespaceName must be provided

duration.description: The duration in milliseconds for the rate limit window.

identifier.description: Identifier of your user, this can be their userId, an email, an ip or anything else. Wildcards ( * ) can be used to match multiple identifiers, More info can be found at https://www.unkey.com/docs/ratelimiting/overrides#wildcard-rules

limit.description: The maximum number of requests allowed.

overrideId.description: The id of the override. This is used internally.

V2RatelimitGetOverrideRequestBody.description: Gets the configuration of an existing override.

namespaceId.description: The id of the namespace. Either namespaceId or namespaceName must be provided

namespaceName.description: The name of the namespace. Either namespaceId or namespaceName must be provided

identifier.description: Identifier of your user, this can be their userId, an email, an ip or anything else. Wildcards ( * ) can be used to match multiple identifiers, More info can be found at https://www.unkey.com/docs/ratelimiting/overrides#wildcard-rules

namespaceId.description: The id of the namespace to list overrides for.

namespaceName.description: The name of the namespace to list overrides for.

cursor.description: Pagination cursor from a previous response

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

namespace.description: The namespace name for the rate limit.

cost.description: The cost of the request. Defaults to 1 if not provided.

duration.description: The duration in milliseconds for the rate limit window.

identifier.description: The identifier for the rate limit.

limit.description: The maximum number of requests allowed.
The maximum number of requests allowed.

remaining.description: The number of requests remaining in the current window.

reset.description: The time in milliseconds when the rate limit will reset.

success.description: Whether the request passed the ratelimit. If false, the request must be blocked.

overrideId.description: The override that was used. May be empty

namespaceId.description: The id of the namespace. Either namespaceId or namespaceName must be provided

namespaceName.description: The name of the namespace. Either namespaceId or namespaceName must be provided

identifier.description: Identifier of the override to delete

externalId.description:
The id of this identity in your system.

This usually comes from your authentication provider and could be a userId, organisationId or even an email.
It does not matter what you use, as long as it uniquely identifies something in your application.

`externalId`s are unique across your workspace and therefore a `CONFLICT` error is returned when you try to create duplicates.

meta.description:
Attach metadata to this identity that you need to have access to when verifying a key.

This will be returned as part of the `verifyKey` response.

ratelimits.description:
Attach ratelimits to this identity.

When verifying keys, you can specify which limits you want to use and all keys attached to this identity, will share the limits.

name.description: The name of this limit. You will need to use this again when verifying a key.

limit.description: How many requests may pass within a given window before requests are rejected.

duration.description: The duration for each ratelimit window in milliseconds.

identityId.description: The id of the identity. Used internally, you do not need to store this.

externalId.description:
The id of this identity in your system.

This usually comes from your authentication provider and could be a userId, organisationId or even an email.
It does not matter what you use, as long as it uniquely identifies something in your application.

id.description: The unique identifier for the permission

name.description: The unique name of the permission

description.description: A description of what this permission grants access to

workspaceId.description: The workspace this permission belongs to

name.description: The unique name of your permission

description.description: Explain what this permission does. This is just for your team, your users will not see this.
description.example: record.write can create new dns records for our domains.

permissionId.description: The id of the permission. This is used internally
The id of the permission to retrieve

limit.description: The maximum number of permissions to return
The maximum number of roles to return

roleId.description: The id of the role to delete

permissionId.description: The id of the permission to delete

name.description: The unique name of your role

description.description: Explain what this role does. This is just for your team, your users will not see this.
description.example: dns.records.manager can read and write dns records for our domains.

permissionIds.description: The permission IDs to assign to this role

roleId.description: The id of the role. This is used internally

id.description: The unique identifier for the role

name.description: The unique name of the role

description.description: A description of what this role represents

workspaceId.description: The workspace this role belongs to

id.description: The unique identifier for the role

name.description: The unique name of the role

description.description: A description of what this role represents

workspaceId.description: The workspace this role belongs to

permissions.description: The permissions assigned to this role

roleId.description: The id of the role to retrieve

name.description: The name for your API. This is not customer facing.

apiId.description: The id of the API you want to delete. API ids always start with `api_`
The id of the api to fetch

duration.description: The duration in milliseconds for the rate limit window.

identifier.description: Identifier of your user, this can be their userId, an email, an ip or anything else. Wildcards ( * ) can be used to match multiple identifiers, More info can be found at https://www.unkey.com/docs/ratelimiting/overrides#wildcard-rules

limit.description: The maximum number of requests allowed.

409.description: This response is sent when a request conflicts with the current state of the server.
Conflict - permission with that name already exists
Conflict - role with that name already exists

get.description: This endpoint checks if the service is alive.
